Key Match Events: Mikel Merino’s goal gives Spain a 2-1 victory over hosts Germany in Extra Time of the quarterfinal of Euro 2024 at the MHP Arena in Stuttgart.
Dani Olmo for Spain opened the scoring after half-time.
Wirtz for Germany scored late in the second half to bring the game to level terms.
Moreno scored in the final moments of the game to secure the win for Spain.
Dani Carvajal received a red card and will not participate in the semifinal.
Kimmich assisted Wirtz's goal for Germany.
Havertz missed a one-on-one chance with the keeper.
Mittellstad received a yellow card for Germany.
Toni Kroos received a yellow card for Germany.
Rudiger received a yellow card for Germany early in the game.
Pre-Game Insights: Julian Nagelsmann, Germany coach, stated: 'It’s not a final, it’s a quarterfinal. We want to be one of the teams in the semifinal. Spain want to be champions as well, so it’ll be a tough game. Both teams are good in possession, have good counter-pressing qualities and can put their opponents under pressure.'

Luis de la Fuente, Spain coach, stated: 'It’s going to be an equal game. It could have been the Euro final and I think it’ll be an even game on a footballing level. Germany always start matches strongly, so obviously we’ll try and counter that. We’ll try and take the initiative and go all-out from the first minute.'
Post-Match Reflections: Disappointment for hosts Germany as they are out of the competition now.
Spanish fans are delighted in the stadium.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game took place at the MHP Arena in Stuttgart.
Spain remains unbeaten in the tournament in five games and qualifies for the semifinals.
Spain will face either France or Portugal in the semifinals.
The match went into extra time.
The stadium capacity is 51,000 and it was inaugurated in 1933.
Others: Spain's route to the quarterfinal included wins over Croatia, Italy, Albania, and Georgia.
Germany's route to the quarterfinal included wins over Scotland, Hungary, and Denmark, and a draw with Switzerland.
Head to head record before the match: Spanish wins: 8, German wins: 9, Draws: 9.
